page.title: 17CONTROVERSEY
page.content: Through the centre of the area runs the North Circular Road, a main orbital route of North London. It is a very heavily used road and there are frequent delays due to the unsuitability of the road for its use. There have been proposals put forward for many years now that wish to widen the road from a single lane in each direction to three lanes each way. The proposals have met with considerable protest from local residents over such factors as increased lead pollution and loss of land etc. A survey carried out by the children of Tudor School showed that despite the heavy usage a great deal of traffic still cuts through the local back streets often at great speed, so perhaps a better NCR would be in the interests of the children at the school.
